com.adeptions.clarguments.converters

Interface ArgumentValueConverter<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MultiValueBooleanConverter, OneZeroBooleanConverter, OnOffBooleanConverter, TrueFalseBooleanConverter, YesNoBooleanConverter
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface ArgumentValueConverter<T>
    Interface for converting incoming raw string arg values to appropriate type

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T convert(int tokenPosition, java.lang.String rawValue, Argument argument, ArgName specifiedArgName)
      Convert the raw incoming arg value string to the appropriate type

    • Method Detail

      • convert

        T convert(int tokenPosition,
          java.lang.String rawValue,
          Argument argument,
          ArgName specifiedArgName)
   throws BadArgException
        Convert the raw incoming arg value string to the appropriate type
        Parameters:
        tokenPosition - the position of the token (in original args[])
        rawValue - the raw string arg value
        argument - the argument for which the value was found
        specifiedArgName - the name by which the argument was specified
        Returns:
        the converted value
        Throws:
        BadArgException - if the conversion fails
